org.beiter.michael.authn.jaas.loginmodules.password.common

Interface PasswordValidator


  • public interface PasswordValidator
    An interface to represent a password validation mechanism.

    Classes implementing this interface must be thread safe.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void init(CommonProperties properties)
      Initializes the password validator configuration.
      boolean validate(char[] providedPassword, char[] storedCredential)
      Validate a user's password against a credential record.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        void init(CommonProperties properties)
        Initializes the password validator configuration.

        A class implementing this interface must provide a reasonable default configuration and handle situations where the validate() method is called without a previous call of init() (i.e. do not throw a runtime exception).

        A class implementing this interface must ensure that subsequent calls to this method update the class' configuration in a thread-safe way.

        Parameters:
        properties - The properties to initialize the password validator with. Supported "additionalParameters" may vary with the implementing classes.

      • validate

        boolean validate(char[] providedPassword,
                 char[] storedCredential)
        Validate a user's password against a credential record.

        A credential record may trivially be a plain text password (insecure, of course), but could also be a password hash or a (serialized) data structure representing a data set for sophisticated validation algorithms.

        Parameters:
        providedPassword - The password to validate (commonly provided by the user)
        storedCredential - The record to validate against (commonly a credential record retrieved from a data store)
        Returns:
        true if the credential could be validated, false otherwise (includes config issues)
